intro: Heterotropa macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered heterotropa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
